member.name: IEnumIDList.Clone
member.summary: Creates a new item enumeration object with the same contents and state as the current one.
member.param: The address of a pointer to the new enumeration object. The calling application must eventually free the new object by calling its member function.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or a COM-defined error value otherwise.

member.name: IEnumIDList.Next
member.summary: Retrieves the specified number of item identifiers in the enumeration sequence and advances the current position by the number of items retrieved.
member.param: The number of elements in the array referenced by the rgelt parameter.

param.name: rgelt
param.para: The address of a pointer to an array of pointers that receive the item identifiers. The implementation must allocate these item identifiers using . The calling application is responsible for freeing the item identifiers using .
The structures returned in the array are relative to the being enumerated.

member.param: A pointer to a value that receives a count of the item identifiers actually returned in rgelt. The count can be smaller than the value specified in the celt parameter. This parameter can be NULL on entry only if celt = 1, because in that case the method can only retrieve one (S_OK) or zero (S_FALSE) items.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if the method successfully retrieved the requested celt elements. This method only returns S_OK if the full count of requested items are successfully retrieved.

S_FALSE indicates that more items were requested than remained in the enumeration. The value pointed to by the pceltFetched parameter specifies the actual number of items retrieved. Note that the value will be 0 if there are no more items to retrieve.
Returns a COM-defined error value otherwise.

member.name: IEnumIDList.Reset
member.summary: Returns to the beginning of the enumeration sequence.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or a COM-defined error value otherwise.

member.name: IEnumIDList.Skip
member.summary: Skips the specified number of elements in the enumeration sequence.
member.param: The number of item identifiers to skip.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or a COM-defined error value otherwise.

member.name: IEnumIDList
member.summary: Exposes a standard set of methods used to enumerate the pointers to item identifier lists (PIDLs) of the items in a Shell folder. When a folder's method is called, it creates an enumeration object and passes a pointer to the object's IEnumIDList interface back to the calling application.
